required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Nutrition for the Colorectal Cancer Patients Receiving Chemotherapy-randomized Controlled Study
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Nutrition for the Colorectal Cancer Patients Receiving Chemotherapy-randomized Controlled Study

brief_summary.textblock: We use clinical trial to explore the effect of nutrition support in colorectal cancer patients receiving postoperative adjuvant chemotherapy.

detailed_description.textblock: Colorectal cancer is the most common cancer in Taiwan. Side effects induced by postoperative adjuvant chemotherapy will affect nutrition status and may delay treatment and affect prognosis. Sarcopenia may be noted in some patients and increase the toxicities of chemotherapy. The studies of intervention include nutrition consultant and treatment like protein, fish oil or Vitamin D supplement. Premium amino acids include multiple amino acids and organic Selenium and have effect in inhibition of tumor proliferation according to colorectal cancer cell and animal experiments.

primary_outcome.description: Evaluation of adverse event(Grade 1-4) between control group and experimental group before every chemotherapy(total 12 times)
albumin level between two group before every chemotherapy(total 12 times)
pre-albumin level between two group before every chemotherapy(total 12 times)

primary_outcome.time_frame: At 1st cycle of chemotherapy (each cycle is 2 weeks).
At 12th cycle of chemotherapy (each cycle is 2 weeks).
At 1st cycle of chemotherapy (each cycle is 2 weeks).
At 12st cycle of chemotherapy (each cycle is 2 weeks).
At 1st cycle of chemotherapy (each cycle is 2 weeks).
At 12th cycle of chemotherapy (each cycle is 2 weeks).
At 1st cycle of chemotherapy (each cycle is 2 weeks).
At 12th cycle of chemotherapy (each cycle is 2 weeks).
At 6th cycle of chemotherapy (each cycle is 2 weeks).
At 12th cycle of chemotherapy (each cycle is 2 weeks).

arm_group.arm_group_label: experimental group: chemotherapy and nutrition support
arm_group.description: Premium amino acids 1pc bid for 6 months

intervention.description: after Chemotherapy ang surgery one pack of Premium Amino Acids in the morning and evening
intervention.arm_group_label: experimental group: chemotherapy and nutrition support

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age > 20
- Radical operation for stage III and stage II with high risk colorectal cancer
- Agree to join the trial and sign the informed consent form
Exclusion Criteria:
- Unable to receive chemotherapy
- Unstable vital sign
- Not suitable after evaluation by Principal Investigator
